amendment.description: Amendment provides funding to expand the National Survey of Child and Adolescent Well-Being to include a study of children impacted by a parents substance addiction to better understand the opioid epidemics impact on maltreated children.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 26 printed in Part B of House Report 116-109 to provide funding to expand the National Survey of Child and Adolescent Well-Being to include a study of children impacted by a parents substance addiction to better understand the opioid epidemics impact on maltreated children.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Butterfield amendment (A026) Agreed to by recorded vote: 356 - 68 (Roll no. 276).

action.text: Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Butterfield amendment (A026) Agreed to by recorded vote: 356 - 68 (Roll no. 276).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A026) offered by Mr. Butterfield.
